revised_title: The Caesium Resonator as a Precise Standard of Frequency and Time
tldr: The authors describe the construction, operation, and performance of a caesium resonator as a standard of frequency and time. The resonance employed is due to the hyperfine splitting of caesium, and the resonator is shown to be nearly independent of the parameters of the apparatus, making it a suitable standard for frequency and time measurement. The resonator has been used to calibrate quartz clocks and correlate atomic and astronomical time.
